name: 1886 Cafe & Bakery - Driskill Hotel
review description: Austin is a great venue for food. 1866 is definitely worth visiting. It is more of a cafe as advertised so the menu is a little limited, but what is available is tasty. Give it a try among several others in the downtown area.

name: 34th Street Cafe
review description: Food and service remarkably good. Only downside is noise level when crowded. Hard surfaces on walls and ceiling provide no damping.

name: ALC Steaks (Austin Land & Cattle)
review description: The steak was melt in your mouth good!

name: Andiamo Ristorante
review description: We had the raviloi special and stuffed chicken with risotto. Great meal

name: ASTI Trattoria
review description: The special once a year lobster fest dinner was terriffic. We shared our meal family style and everyone loved each of the choices. We brought our own wine, which you can do at a few Austin restaurants, and were very appreciative of the service that they provide to accomodate our own wine. We enjoy this restaurant all the time and highly recommend it.

name: ate.cafe
review description: Went there for Easter brunch. Food was fresh and tasty. Portions were large. Coffee was excellent although the cups were too small!

name: August E's
address: 203 East San Antonio Street Fredericksburg, TX  78624
review description: Nice place. Good food. I was a little annoyed that they were out of the two items on the menu that I thought were reasonably priced (the new York strip my first choice for $41, and the Pork chop my second choice for $25) were both sold out at 7:15pm. Then my only other choice for steak were $80 and $65. I'm sure they were probably great choices, but a little pricey for my budget. I ended up going with the "off the menu" choice of sea scallopes. Which was good, but not really what I was in the mood for. I understand sometimes restaurants run out of things, but really, the first two items on your menu and it's only 7:15 on a Saturday?

name: Bartlett's
review description: This is formerly Houston's and they maintain the same menu and level of service. The Baked Potato Soup is delicious. The grilled chicken salad is huge and a long-time favorite from the Houston's days.

name: Botticelli's
review description: Excited to try something new - however I wanted the food to be vibrant and flavor explosions but the food was ok

name: Braise
review description: The food was AMAZING! the appetizers (sausage and grits and spring rolls) were great, the salad with watermelon and pork belly was TO DIE FOR! The pork belly and the "liquid pumpkin pie" were our favorites. Entrees were good (osso bucco (sp?) and Salisbury steak) not as good as the first 2 courses but still tasty and by the time dessert came, we had to take it to go...STUFFED! (the berry crumble was amazing...bread pudding not as much but maybe cause I ate it at midnight)The place is small, quiet and the wine list is great. The paintings are whimsical and brighten up the place. The service was perfect! We never had an empty water glass. WE WILL RETURN with friends!

name: Brizo's
review description: The cost of the brunch was a little out of line for the spread tht was served.

name: Buca di Beppo - Austin
review description: As a former food service worker,I have been privledged to work and eat at various locales and have finally found an establishment that provides everything I have always wanted.Good food,service,atmosphere,and price ,all has been met with some above and beyond techniques.I would highley reccommend this establishment to any and all patrons for the sole vpurpose of going out and enjoying your meal on your timetable.

name: Cafe Josie
review description: Cafe Josie is simply one of the best restaurants in Austin. The food is always terrific and the staff is friendly and professional.

name: Cafe Malta
address: 3421 W. William Cannon Dr., #127 Austin, TX  78745
review description: Surprising little restaurant tucked away in a nondescrpt strip center location. Don't be put off! Well worth the visit....and many returns. Tastefull interior design and music. Liked the playlist. Interesting selection of cocktails and the menu offers lots of delicious choices. Fresh and imaginative. Food is both lovely and lively. Great waitstaff who are attentive and know the menu. I've had Brunch, Lunch and Dinner here and loved every dish!

name: Cantina Laredo - Austin
review description: We left the experience with a "meh" feeling. The service was slow. It was apparent that they were under staffed on the evening of July 4th. They were trying...the busboy was friendly and accommodating as he could be. The ceviche was fishy and room temperature. Salsa wasn't refilled. This was necessary as we ran out of salsa during the long ansences in service. The frozen margaritas had probably been sitting in the window for a while as they arrived partially melted. The salted rim wasn't really.

name: Carillon Restaurant
review description: Me and my husband love this place, the food and the desserts are awesome!!!!!

name: Carmelo's Ristorante Italiano - Austin
review description: There were six of us, and one particular ordered did not come out as stated from the menu, Chicken Alfredo (no onions). The guest chose that particular item, because she does not eat onions. Unfortunately, upon arrival, you could visiably see the red onion throughout. The waiters were addressed, and the food returned to the kitchen. The next plate came out, and there were green onions sprinkled atop. The waiters were addressed and debated with the guest as to having no onions. They returned the plate to the kitchen and came back with a plain plate of alfredo. She was just about in tears. I think that the communication skills of the waiters is lacking, and/or did not clearly comprehend her requests the first two times.

name: Chez Zee
review description: I guess it's a good thing when a resturant is crowded, but it also means it can be very noisy. If you want to catch up with old friends, you have to ask them to repeat their story on occasion. Piano music and conversation can compete with each other. Love the decor and neighborhood vibe.

name: Cipollina
review description: Food was pretty delicious, smaller portions so don't expect to take anything home. Prices where a little high for what it was IMO. I'm not dying to go back, but may someday if need a new place to take a date. Though definitely not a first date.

name: Clay Pit
review description: Had access to a private room for our party of 14. Food was great, atmosphere was fantastic. Service needed quite a bit of work. Our server couldn't handle 14. Could have used a second set of hands. Even if it was just for water refills. Had a hard time getting second round of drinks. Had to go look for our server on a few occasions.

name: Congress
review description: Excellent food but extremely expensive. The bill caught us off guard.

name: Contigo Austin
review description: We had a large group with last minute changes and Dana and her staff was extremely helpful and flexible. We had a wonderful time and the people in our party were extremely pleased and impressed with the venue and food!

name: Cool River Cafe - Austin
review description: The hostess sat us next to a loud table, when there was plenty of room in the restaurant. One waiter (I didn't get her name) saw we were uncomfortable and moved us. We mentioned several times it was my birthday - and nothing special was done. I asked the waiter not to put our order in too soon after appetizers, but he did anyway. My scallops were good, but the asparagus was so salty I had to send it back. My husband's pork chop was not done all the way through, so it had to go back to be re-fired. We had been here 3 years ago for our anniversary and it was very nice. Not sure we'll go back.

name: Copa Bar and Grill
review description: Good food but not good enough for that price...

name: Cotton Gin Cabernet Grill
review description: The food was outstanding. My husband likes steak/chicken while I prefer seafood. Excellent choices for both of us. The shrimp scampi was wonderful and the pecan crusted chicken breast was perfectly cooked and flavorful. Service was timely and friendly. Love the wine list.

name: Cypress Grill
address: 4404 W William Cannon Dr., Ste L Austin, TX  78749
review description: Great food. Delicious catfish dish and chocolate pecan pie.

name: Daily Grill - Austin
address: 11506 Century Oaks Terrace Suite 100 Austin, TX  78758
review description: We love this restaurant! It has never failed to come through with awesome offerings. Our waitperson was great (Marquae) and the manager stopped by our table to see if we were enjoying our meal. His name is Emmanuel. These are all great people who make you feel welcome. Again, we really like this gem of a restaurant at the Domain.

name: Driskill Grill - Driskill Hotel
review description: The wait staff was very attentive but not overly so. My wife's Salmon entree was undercooked but that happens occasionally with fish. We just have little tolerance for it. Their second attempt was perfect though it would have been a better experience had they got it right the first time. Very nice hotel with a lot of history. I highly recommend staying there.

name: Eddie V's - 5th Street
review description: Great seafood! Preparation was excellent.

name: Eddie V's - Arboretum
review description: Absolutely perfect evening! The food was perfectly prepared...presentation was beautiful! And the waiter was the best!

name: eleven plates & wine
address: 3801 N Capital of Texas Hwy Ste. C-200 Austin, TX  78746
review description: We had GREAT service, an excellent meal and the prices are very reasonable. We'll be back...often.

name: The Emerald Restaurant
review description: We had a great time. The service was extra ordinary. We could talk and not have to shout which was wonderful for the evening.

name: Estancia Churrascaria - Arboretum
address: 10000 Research Blvd. Suite B Austin, TX  78759
review description: The service was outstanding. Never waiting on the next cut of meat or condiments.

name: finn & porter
address: Hilton Austin 500 E 4th St. Austin, TX  78701
review description: The food was great! My boyfriend and I decided to have dinner here while we were visiting Austin for the weekend and I am sure glad we did. Our waitress was wonderful so friendly and very helpful. This is a place I would surely come back to.

name: FINO Restaurant, Patio, and Bar
review description: Great tapas!!! Excellent variety, fresh and well prepared

name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Austin
review description: It was our anniversary and i ordered flowers for our table but they never arrived so the reservationist offered to go get us flowers. The waitress was fantastic and friendly and really made our special nite special. We ordered off there summer menu and really enjoyed our lite summer meal. The dessert was out of this world. Flemings is the perfect place for a romantic evening.

name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Austin The Domain
review description: Great service - the food was excellent. Asked for a booth and a specific waitperson - no problem. The service here always seems to be among the best in town. The Ahi tuna small plate was wonderful. Our steaks were cooked to perfection. Will be returning, undoubtedly!

name: Fore
address: 900 Ranch Rd 620 S, Ste B108 Lakeway, TX  78734
review description: Good Fathers Day brunch. The reservation gave us a perfect place to see & hear my 2 teenage guitar students who were performing. All in all a good time.

name: Garrido's Restaurant
review description: My husband and I have been to Garrido's many times, we took some friends of ours on Fiday for the first time. We got sat right away which is unusual since they are always busy but they were not actually kinda slow. The bar was not even packed. It took about 7 minutes before our waitress even came to get a drink order which took forever for her to return with even water. I asked to order some quac and queso as she was passing by, again it took a while to get. This visit was not what Garrido's is usually like, we love to go for the ambience, the food and especially the drinks. We have had better service when they are more busy, much more busy.

name: The Grille At Rough Hollow
review description: Ate on the patio for a sunset dinner. The view and the food were great. I recommend the filet and the chocolate bread pudding.

name: Gumbo's Louisiana Style Cafe - Downtown
review description: We asked for a quiet place and they found the quietest in the restaurant, thank you very much.

name: Gumbo's Steak and Seafood - Bee Cave
review description: Salmon Robert is always excellent. Salads are always crisp and fresh. Highly recomend.

name: gusto italian kitchen + wine bar
address: 4800 Burnet Road Suite B-200 Austin, TX  78756
review description: Great happy hour specials if you get there early!

name: Haddingtons
review description: Extremely noisy in front!!! Otherwise great experience

name: Hemingway Restaurant and Bar
address: 500 Cypress Creek Rd., Ste 170 Cedar Park, TX  78613
review description: I totally loved it and can't wait to get back!

name: HomeField Grill
address: 2000 S. IH 35 Suite D-1 Round Rock, TX  78681
review description: My wife and I like to go to different places just to try them out. I saw Homefield Grill online and thought it would be worth a shot. We shared the cheddar bats, the chicken cordon bleu and the beef short rib with mac and cheese and truffle. The smashed potatoes that came with the Chicken were our least favorite, though still good. Everything else was outstanding. We ate too much to get desert, but since we plan on going back (probably again and again), we'll catch it next time!

name: Hudson's On The Bend
review description: Our server was excellent, very knowledgeable and friendly.

name: Hugo's Restaurant and Tequila Bar
review description: Service and food were excellent. Very good sized portions for a very affordable price. It was extremely loud inside the restaurant for as few tables as were there, so we moved outside to the deck, and it was great. Not a particularly scenic view (Schlotsky's and Lamar), but the deck is situated well for afternoon sun.

name: Hyatt Lost Pines - Firewheel Cafe
address: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines Road Cedar Creek, TX  78612
review description: Ate Christmas Brunch in the Firewheel Cafe. Nice selection but the food was just so-so. Overall a nice time and the service is excellent.

name: Hyde Park Bar & Grill - Duval
review description: Love the french fries. Sonora salad was great.

name: Hyde Park Bar & Grill - West Gate
address: 4521 B West Gate Blvd Austin, TX  78745
review description: Went to Hyde Park Bar & Grill- Westgate for my birthday dinner. I had made reservations prior, so that helped with getting the table for 8 that my party consisted of. We were seated on time. The waiter showed up right away, took everyone's drink orders, and asked if we wanted appetizers. Drinks showed up pretty soon after ordering. Then orders were taken for dinner. I ordered the basil grilled chicken with wild rice pilaf and spice roasted sweet potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak with fries and steamed broccoli. My sisters had the pork roast shephards pie and grilled salmon. Their boyfriends had the potato-crusted tilapia and chicken fried chicken. Overall, everyone was pleased with their meals. Waiter had BAD BAD breath

name: III Forks Austin
review description: Good quality steaks, excellent service. Nice that they don't nickel and dime you for every side order. We had the NY Strip streaks and they were excellent.

name: Imperia
review description: Good for bros and hipsters and people who enjoy fatty, saucy, stuffed with cream cheese sushi rolls that do not show off the flavors or textures of the fish or come close to resembling what sushi is all about. I felt like I ate dinner at McDonalds after those rolls. Uchi has made me unable to have sushi anywhere else. But, if you enjoy those fried, fatty, saucy rolls have it. You will fit right in.Plus my fiance ordered a ginger mojito, I do not think there was any alcohol in it, it was the weakest drink I have ever had.

name: Jasper's - Austin
review description: Good food and good atmosphere. Somewhat inconsistent from first try to second visit.

name: Josey's
review description: Excellent staff and food was great!!!

name: Judges' Hill Restaurant
review description: This Restaurant is amazing! The food is incredible and creative! Should be named a top 3 restaurant in Austin!

name: Kenichi
review description: Kenichi is always a hit in my book. The food is delicious and the waitstaff is always fantastic while not being overbearing or annoying. The menu items at Kenichi are so unique and it's definitely a menu that you will not find at other sushi restaurants. Since first trying Kenichi some four years ago it still remains my favorite sushi restaurant hands down. If only it were a little closer to what I call home :)

name: Kona Grill - Austin
address: 11410 Century Oaks Terrace The Domain Austin, TX  78758
review description: Love the generous portion sizes and the unique offerings.

name: La Condesa
review description: Love the salsa groupings and guacamole very good. I especially love the margaritas. Always fun and delicious!

name: Lambert's Downtown BBQ
review description: Very good menu, fried oysters were the best I´ve had. upscale barbecue and local specialties. It can get loud, specially upstairs where frequently there is a band playing.

name: Lantana Grill
address: 200 Hi Circle North Horseshoe Bay, TX  78657
review description: We were so disappointed in the Lantana Grill. The reviews stated it was a wonderful Hill-Country grill, with great ambiance. It's a hotel restaurant, with an interesting menu, although the food was not good. We were expecting a nice, quiet restaurant with some atmosphere. Will not return.

name: Las Palomas Restaurant-Bar
review description: Great Mariachi performers! Nice menu selections and well prepared.

name: Maggiano's - Austin
review description: Great service, amazing homemade food, good atmosphere, and the best Italian!!!

name: Main Street Grill
address: 118 E. Main St. Round Rock, TX  78664
review description: We had a wonderful time at Main Street Grill. The food was excellent and prepared as we requested. The staff were professional and knowledgable on all menu items. The desserts were fantastic.

name: Malaga Tapas & Bar
review description: The waiter was helpful in recommending dishes and helping us to divide a gazpacho order. The four of us all enjoyed everything we ordered.

name: Manuel's Downtown
review description: We've lived in Austin for over 30 years but triedManuel's for the first time a few months ago & loved it.Now it's among our favorites (one of the top 3).

name: Manuel's Great Hills
review description: I was very disappointed with the price of my Tostada Nortena, $12.50 for a small tostada, with tomatoes, lettuce, guacomole, black beans. It was the size of an appetizer for two. Taste was good...prices not so much. And it was quiet because people were not coming out in the storm...the tables were quite empty. I would not go back for dinner...maybe happy hour.

name: Max's Wine Dive - Austin
review description: A great place for people who love wine but get intimidated by large wine lists. The staff is very helpful when ordering vino and even let you try almost any wine before you buy it. Oh, and the food is incredible.

name: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Austin (Century Oaks)
review description: Wife's Birthday. The host sat us right in back of a large noisy group. I could not even hear my wife's voice because the group was so loud. We asked to be moved. Now the rest of the whole entire restaurant seating was available. They sat us down in the far corner away from them. Then sat someone else on the other side of us as if the other 30 tables couldn't be used. Host made horrible choices. Waitstaff was great and the kitchen cooked great food. Wine was excellent and the $210 spent was worth it on my wife and I.

name: The Melting Pot - Austin - Northwest
review description: Celebrated my birthday. Hostess brought us free drinks to go with our chocolate fondue... also, I forgot my coupon for the free chocolate strawberries you can get for your birthday and they gave them to me anyway. I will definitely go back to celebrate other occasions and have already spread the word to friends.

name: Mizu Prime Steaks & Sushi
review description: great to see Mizu back at it....dinner was as great as it used to be

name: NoRTH - Austin
review description: Again, North was spectacular. We love this place and will continue to dine there.

name: Old Pecan St. Cafe
review description: We had a Ladies Night Out (6 of us). We ate at the Pecan St. Cafe then went to Esthers Follies. Returned to the Cafe for dessert after the show. The food was great and out water was very good.

name: Olive and June
review description: Really enjoyed it...recommend sitting downstairs. Ambience is much more interesting...you can see the wine room in one direction, the kitchen in another, and the patio with large oak tree in another. Upstairs is darker and more subdued. Happy hour until 7 so good deals on apps and cocktails.

name: Paggi House
review description: Mighta been the company or the perfect soft Summer evening in Austin, but Wednesday night at Paggi House was almost perfect. Helpful somalier confirmed my interest in an Anderson Valley pinot (off the full and interesting list); she had Caprese salad with perfect, fresh local tomatoes and a frozen pannacotta that they freeze and them melt onto it before they serve it -- fantastic. I had some sort of butter lettuce, pears, nuts, cheese and vanilla vinaigrette salad thing, and it was also excellent. We split the pork tenderloin with roasted peaches - very reasonable "split" fee and a perfect amount of food so we had room for desert. German chocolate tart with smoked caramel ice cream was the best part of the meal. Just outstanding.

name: Parkside
review description: My group had a great experience; loved the food and atmosphere! Our waitress was very attentative and knowledgeable. We will definitely come back again.

name: Perla's Seafood and Oyster Bar
address: 1400 S Congress Suite B100 Austin, TX  78704
review description: Very good food, but a bit overpriced. $28 for a small piece of (excellent tasting) fish with no sides.

name: Perry's Steakhouse & Grille - Downtown
review description: Steak was not very good. The butter seasoning they use it too rich. This gave us stomach problems later in the night and the day after. We were expecting much more fine cuisine than just steak and sides. The price was too much for the lack of creativity in the food preparation and design. The place is known for pork chops, but we discovered that later and probably should have ordered that. But, shouldn't a steakhouse be known for steak?

name: Posado's - Austin
review description: The reservation was not received by Posada's through OpenTable. I called to verify and the reservation was not handled until I walked in the door. It took them 15-20 mins to set us up.

name: Ranch 616
review description: Interesting food. Great service. Lively atmosphere. Definitely will return to this fun restaurant.

name: Roaring Fork-Downtown, Congress
review description: This wasn't our first visit to Roaring Fork. As always, the waitstaff was excellent, helpful and friendly. The food was perfect and exactly as we ordered - as well as absolutely delicious. (Especially the grits served with the bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin!) Our recent visit just ensured we'd be back again soon.

name: Roaring Fork-North Austin, Stonelake
review description: Fairly straight forward meat centric menu with some nice takes on otherwise traditional fare. But be prepared to get your beef on...absolutely no vegetarian entrees. Nice wine selection but surprisingly weak on beer. Nice layout, ambiance, lighting, view of the small lake, and solid service.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Austin
address: 107 W. 6th Street The Scarborough Building Austin, TX  78701
review description: Awesome, great food, service and wine!!

name: The Salty Sow
review description: Food was ok, which is Austin isn't good enough. Service was spotty. Overall the experience was good but there are too many great restaurants in Austin so good isn't good enough. They also seem overly anxious about turning over the tables.

name: Santa Catarina Restaurant
review description: The service at Santa Catarina was very good and the restaurant has a nice "feel", but no one in our group of four liked their food. Our opinions ranged from OK, a c-, to very bad, an F. There are many options in the area with much better Mexican food. Do not waste your time or money on Santa Catarina!

name: Satay Restaurant
address: 3202 W. Anderson Lane Ste #205 Austin, TX  78757
review description: Another delicious dinner at Satay ... our favorite neighborhood Thai. I am now hooked on Dr. Foo's speciality, Bai Thong -- Red Snapper cooked in banana leaves ... spicy, but oh so good! Service, as always, was excellent.

name: Satellite Bistro and Bar
review description: We had the shrimp linguine and the burger. Both were good.

name: Second Bar + Kitchen
review description: Awesome food and great service!

name: Shore Club
review description: Excellent view and easy acces to the marina for all your water sports needs!best in Tx !

name: Siena Ristorante Toscano
address: 6203 Capital of Texas Hwy Austin, TX  78731
review description: Siena has become our favorite Italian restaurant in Austin. Both the food and the service are outstanding!

name: Steiner Ranch Steakhouse
review description: We found the patio to have a great view but the live entertainment was too loud for our liking so we ate inside with the piano. Rudy was excellent in his attention to serving us and the meal was magnificent. Loved the piano. Portions were HUGE. This place was a "find" because of OpenTable listing.

name: Stories Fine Dining Establishment at Hyatt Regency Lost Pines
address: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines Rd. Cedar Creek, TX  78612
review description: The meal, the atmosphere and the service were worth every penny of it.

name: Sullivan's Steakhouse - Austin
review description: Steaks overcooked, but overall a good meal.

name: Sushi Zushi of 5th Street
review description: Before I attend this restaurant I was craving for really good sushi; although I was spectacle about the place, I can assure you this restaurant got the job done. They had a range of sushi selections that I even had trouble in making a decision on what to eat. My significant other and I went for dinner on a Wednesday, even though it was week days the restaurant seemed busy. Our waitress was very nice and knowledgeable about the menu which it can be very helpful when there’re so many good choices to choose from. Everything that I flavor from the menu I was very satisfy and this is coming from a female who’s very finicky about her eating habits. Parking at first was a little puzzle if you’re not familiar with the location, but if you drive ar

name: Sushi Zushi of the Domain
review description: Our dining experience at Sushi Zushi started off on the wrong foot. Our OpenTable was not on their computer. They asked me four times if I was someone else, or if I had made the reservation at one of their other locations. Thankfully I had the confirmation email from Open Table on my smart phone. Finally the manager came over, apologized, and said he would square it away to make sure I got my dining points.

name: SWB @ the Hyatt Regency Austin
review description: This was recommended to me by a GSR at another hotel, and it was the worst experience I've ever had, bar none. We only saw our server twice, but when she brought us the check, she was friendly as can be. It took 45 minutes to get our food and we got it before people who were there far before we were. It seemed as though the staff and kitchen couldnt handle the magnitude of service that was there. You should probably get an entire new crew. I went down to the concierge, who was probably the friendliest person I came across. Kudos to her. She was the only person who made us feel welcome in the entire place.

name: Swift's Attic
review description: The kitchen is always keeping the dishes new and fresh. We especially loved the Tuna Tatak and antelope steak.

name: Trace - W - Austin
review description: We enjoyed everything about the evening, can't wait to go back.

name: Trattoria Lisina
review description: Excellent food, beautiful restaurant. Very interesting menu

name: Trento
address: 3600D N. Capital of Texas Hwy. Austin, TX  78746
review description: We came here for happy hour, we were blown away by the service and food. Started off with the stuffed meatballs and PEI mussels, we also ordered the spinach and margarita pizza. We were a large party and our server Sarah was really on top of things. We loved the drinks Trento offers, especially the hummingbird with prosecco and st Germaine. Definitely bringing friends back for happy hour.

name: TRIO - Four Seasons Austin
review description: The setting was gorgeous. the restaurant set us up based on our request for a round table in advance. They were very accommodating to my no dairy, no gluten requests and the chef even specially prepared hot gluten free bread with olive oil. Very thoughtful gesture! The steaks were perfectly cooked. The chicken was the tastiest chicken we have ever had at a restaurant and beautifully presented. Our waiter was perfect. All in all a wonderful dining experience. It's also a great place to spend an evening as the walk along town lake is beautiful.

name: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Arboretum
review description: Always a fan of Trulucks. The food is outstanding. The service was a bit slow on this occasion, but no problem as we had plenty of time.

name: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Downtown
review description: Fantastic experience. I highly recommend Trulucks Downtown. Service was impeccable from the mgmt (Andrew) to the wait staff (Tiffany). Food was awesome!

name: Uchi
review description: Fabulous! If you love great food, you will love Uchi. Every dish is special, I can't pick just one to recommend.

name: Uchiko
address: 4200 N Lamar Blvd. Suite 140 Austin, TX  78756
review description: Awesome as always! This restaurant can be a bit pricey but it is worth every penny of it.

name: urban an american grill
review description: Everything from top to bottom was great from salad to dessert and the service was exceptional. Everything was so fresh and such a relief from the typical Preserved meals at Other restaurants.

name: Vince Young Steakhouse
review description: Our first time to Vince Young Steakhouse (about 6 months ago), I wrote a glowing review about how great an experience it was. This, our second time, it was the polar opposite experience. The service was really terrible. The food was good (better than most places), but even it fell flat compared to the first time. We sat for over 5 minutes before we had a server greet us to ask for drinks. We waited another 10 min for those drinks (water, sprite). We waited 30 minutes for our appetizer (Crispy Pork Belly), and *another* 30 minutes (over an hour total) to *get* our entrees. We never got offered bread, until I saw another table get the bread and I asked *another* server for some. Overall, left a lot to be desired. Very disappointing.

name: wink
address: 1014 North Lamar Blvd. Ste. E Austin, TX  78703
review description: The wait staff was incredible. The food was to DIE FOR. Whole experience was probably the best restaurant experience I've ever had. The staff knew our names when we walked in, and wished my boyfriend a Happy Birthday since we were celebrating that...they had even printed custom menus that said Happy Birthday on the top with his name, and saved us one so we could bring it home. I can't wait to save up and go back again!

name: Zandunga Mexican Bistro
review description: Chef Edgar always delights from the kitchen. Since I've ordered everything on the menu, I now typically lean toward the special because it's always delicious, unexpected, and something I wouldn't (or couldn't) cook at home. Dawn and Christina in the front of the house are superb: efficient and concerned about the food and service. I couldn't ask for better in a restaurant.

name: Zax Restaurant & Bar
review description: The food is delicious, the service is very good, both from hosts and wait staff and I love Wednesday's pint night. The appetizers and drink specials are amazing, particularly the shrimp pesto fontina pizza, which is a favorite, but the steak salad is amazing, too.

name: Z'Tejas Arboretum
review description: Good service, but abysmal food and drinks.

name: Z'Tejas Austin 6th St
review description: Place was good! A little pricey but perfect for a date or special occasion. Service was meh but it was busy, so it wasn't a deal breaker. Unique menu with lots of choice.

name: Z'Tejas Avery Ranch
review description: We enjoyed our lunch. Many great menu items to choose. Would be kid friendly if the kid food (mac n cheese) wasn't spicy. Manager and wait staff very friendly and helpful.
